Software Developer

Software Developer currently located in Reno, NV, but actively looking for work in the San Francisco Bay Area. Especially interested in a career in video game development.

Experience

Raven Electronics Corporation

Software Engineer • Nov, 2014 — Present

  • Instrumental in the design and implementation of a flagship desktop client that interfaced with current server product via WCF.
  • Identified the need for and led the institution of an issue tracking system (JIRA).
  • Designed and implemented a licensing system for an existing product.
  • Implemented a Java application that interfaced with an in-house API for testing and demonstrative purposes.

Education

University of Nevada, Reno

Bachelors of Science, Computer Science and Engineering • Dec 2016

Projects

Arduino MEGA Roguelike Game

Class Project, Sole Developer • Nov, 2015

Developed the prototype of a roguelike adventure game that runs on an Arduino MEGA embedded system.

Features include:

  • 2D sprites that are encoded to a single C header file using a custom python script.
  • Dual joystick input for moving and attacking.
  • Enemies and simple combat.
  • 1.8" LCD display output.
  • Fully portable, self-contained case.

Full source code, photos, and documentation are available on my github.

League of Legends Platformer

Personal Project, • Spring, 2013

Programmed a simple, side-scrolling platformer that included collsions, animations, and basic physics. Programmed in C++ using Allegro for game logic/rendering, and Tiled as a level editor. Also implemented a parser to convert the output from Tiled into a format usable in Allegro.

ADS-B Drone Collision Avoidance

Class Project, Senior Projects • May, 2016

Implemented an autonomous drone collision avoidance system that utilized ADS-B signal parsing to get the location of nearby aircraft to modify the flight route of the drone. Written in Python and developed with the help of local drone company Nevada Dynamics. Integrated with Google Maps and utilized Tkinter (for debugging UI).
